item.title: Don't Call Me Daughter
item.description: I’d like to tell you a story, one that my mother told me when I was younger about my own birth, one she told me it was true. But before I do, it’s probably worth mentioning that I once told this story (some time after my mother died) while my father was around, and he vehemently denied that it ever happened. My parents were married in 1961. My mom wanted to have children, but by ‘65 or ‘66 it hadn’t happened yet.
